title: verify the package code and description in nav map view

custom_steps_separated.content:

1) Special characters, integers and alphanumeric
2) German and Dutch language conversions
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The package code and description is shown above the seat view and the event navigation tools and filter are available.  
(The package code and description shall continue to display in the selected event portlet.)
This field shall be static, not a dropdown as it is in single event sales.  It shall only â€˜changeâ€™ as the user is navigated from list to list if a multi-list package is in context. 
Compare with the PRD for the mock up and view

title: verify the hold code display when in nav map

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. verify the dislplay of nav map when the map is loaded for the first time with default holdcode
verify the display when we switch to a different hold code when in nav map to which user has access
verify the nav map when the seats in all the events are not in the same hold code and we set that holdcode in context.
custom_steps_separated.expected: 1. The ability to select a hold code and reflect sections with availability for that hold code shall exist for package list composite navigation maps. Availability should be based on a seat being available for all events in the list, i.e. a seat must have the same hold code in each event to present as available for that selected hold code.

1. 1) we should zoom in using the '+' option present at the right hand bottom of the screen 
2) we should zoom out using the '_' option present at the right hand bottom of the screen

title: verify the seatmap legend in compostie map

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. verify the seat map legend for the below conditions:
- Some seats are available for all events
-Some seats are not available for all events  but not for others (few of the seats are sold as part of the single event sale for some of the events in the package)
-  seats are sold as part of package so not aviable
- some seat are locked by a different user
- some seats are locked by the same user in a different cart.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. the seatmap shall have the following values:
only seats aviable across all event should be selectable when seating in composite mode(provided they have other access).
All other seat should be unselectable

seatmap legend should have the same display:
1. Partially Available Unselectable legend item
2. Partially Available Unselectable indicator on seats
3. Partially Available Selectable legend item
4. Partially Available Selectable indicator on seats 
Refer to PRD-Mocukup for the UI and display(font, placement and colors)

2. Navigate to Ticketing setup > Event 
administration

venue
4. Set the Event ticket quota 5 and ESC

enforce

7.Set Ticket Quota to 4 for Price Scale SPS1 
in the OAKA venue
8.Navigate to supplier administration
9.Select Buyer types form the dropdown 
->Select the ADULT 
10.Set Ticket Quota to 3 for Buyer Type Adult.                            
11.Navigate to tickets sales                                                          
12. Select the event and purchase 4 ticket 
from ESD defined area

2. Verify whether  the buyer type, price scale 
ticket quota validations are performed for 
inventoried events
Expected Result:
Expected Result:
The buyer type validations should be 
performed for inventoried events
3. Uncheck the Buyer quota enforce
Expected Result:
uncheck successful
4. Select the event and purchase 5 ticket from ESD 
defined area
Expected Result:
selection successful
5. Verify whether  the price scale ticket quota 
validations are performed for inventoried events
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Expected Result:
The buyer and price scale validations should be 
performed for inventoried events and displayed with in the map

finamncial patron selected

seats locked

account in context.

title: Verify the locked package seats in map is released if it is not added to cart due to Event quota vilation error

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. 1. Create a new Inclusive Tax ( ITR1 )under the Organization Administration -> Configuration-> Inclusive Tax.
2. Inclusive tax ITR1 should be having tax rate set. 
3. Create a new Inclusive Tax Group (ITG1) under the Organization Administration -> Configuration-> Inclusive Tax Group. Check the Report Group Types as " Report Output Group"
4. Include the created Inclusive Tax ITR1 to the created Tax Group(ITG1). Means Select ITG1from the Inclusive Tax Group drop down.
5. Create an event E1 with the created Inclusive Tax ITR1 mapped to it. 
6. Createa a new Ticket INCLUSIVE SERVICE CHARGE (TISC). Include Event E1 to the created Ticket INCLUSIVE SERVICE CHARGE (TISC).  Also Include the  Inclusive Tax ( ITR1 ) to Ticket INCLUSIVE SERVICE CHARGE (TISC).
Expected Result:
The Prerequsite should be completed successfully.
2. Launch PV Application using the appropriate URL
Expected Result:
PV Application should be launched successfuly
3. Login to the PV Application using suitable credentials
Expected Result:
Login should be successfull
4. 1. Navigate to the Ticket sales portal
2. Select the event E1 created in the pre-requisite
3. Give ticket count and click Best Available button
4. Click on the button near to the Grand Total label in the cart
5. Verify Inclusive tax details.

Don't checkout
Expected Result:
The VAT - Inclusive Tax Summary modal pop-up should get displayed.

It should display the tax calculation based ITR1 

Three columns should be displayed 
a) INCLUSIVE TAX
b) RATE
c) Inclusive Tax Amount

1.The Inclusive Tax amount for ITR1 is based on the Total Ticket price (Actual ticket price - the Inclusive Service Charge amount) should be shown in a seperate row.

The Inclusive Tax amount is calculated based on the formulae [ (Ticket sales amount) / (100 + %tax rate) *  %tax rate ]

2.    Since created Inclusive Tax ITR1 is associated with the Tax Group ITG1, Group subtotal should be available. 

3. Since the event and service charges have inclusive tax associated to them, Inclusive tax amounts should be calculated separately for Ticket Amount and the service charge amount.

On the display only one line should be displayed for the Inclusive Tax Amount with the sum of respective tax for the Event and Service Charge. 

4. Inclusive Tax toal should be the net  total of all inclusive taxes in the transaction.

and a CLOSE button

Note:
Inclusive Tax amount corresponding to Ticket amount is calculated based on the inclusive tax associated to the event.
(If the Ticket amount includes ticket inclusive service charge, inclusive tax amount is calculated after deducting this inclusive service charge amount)

Inclusive Tax amount corresponding to service charge amount is calculated based inclusive tax associated to the service charge.
5. 1. Add the delivery method
2. Do payment 
3. Check out the cart
Expected Result:
The cart should get checked out successfully
6. 1. Navigate to the ticket service portal and launch the Order View.
2. verify the Inclusive tax values in the INCLUSIVE TAX tab
Expected Result:
All the details should be same as that noted down in the Ticket Sales portal (as in Step 4)
7. 1. Click on the Log out link.
Expected Result:
Application should be logged out successfully.
custom_steps_separated.expected: 1. Quota validation errors should be displayed in the map

title: verify behaviour when locking seats to a pricescale with limits set via map

title: Perform a full package exchange reservation selecting less number of tickets exchanged  when Allow Break Exchange Quantity rule is False_Exchge using map sales

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Login the application using the suitable credentials
Expected Result:
The user should be able to login the application successfully
2. 1. Navigate to the Event administration portal
2. Click the New button to create a New Event 
3. Enter the mandatory fields 
4. Click on Apply Changes button

Repeat the same step to create few more Events
Expected Result:
The user should be able to create the event successfully
3. 1. Navigate to the Package event list portal
2. Click on New to create a New Package event list
3. Enter the mandatory data
4. Click on Apply changes
5. Click the Event Tab 
6. Search for the 2 Events created above 
7. Click the Include Button and click the apply Apply changes button
8. Navigate to Details tab and set the Status to Available
9. Click on Apply changes

Repeat the above steps to create another PEL
Expected Result:
The user should be able to create the Package Event Lists successfully
4. 1. Naviage to the Package administration
2. Click on New to create a new Package
3. Enter the Mandatory fields and click the Apply changes button
4. Click the Event Lists tab
5. Search for the Event Lists created above 
6. Click the Include button
7. Select Manual from the dropdown and select Apply
8. CLick on Apply changes
9. Navigate to the Details tab 
10 Set the Package status to Onsale
11. Click on Apply changes
Expected Result:
The user should be able to create the package successfully
5. 1. Set the Same Quantity in the Exchanges Panel to true
2. Set the Force Fixed Quantity to True and click on Apply changes
3. Click the Package Access tab
4. Set Allow Break Exchange Context Rules to True and Allow Break Exchange Quantity Rule option to False
5. Click on Apply changes
Expected Result:
The user should be able to Set the above permissions
6. 1. Navigate to the Ticket Sales Portal
2. Select the Package Radio button
3. Search for the package created above
4. Select the package created above 
5. Click the Map tab
6. Select the Package Details tab in the Left 
7. Select Per Event tab
8. Select each Event and select the seats (user should not be able to select different number of seats for different events)
9. Click Add to the Cart
10.Click on Reserve link in shopping cart
11.Select reservation date and click on Set to Reservation button
12. Click the Checkout button
Expected Result:
The user should be able to complete the package reservation  transaction successfully
7. 1. Navigate to the TIcket services portal
2. Search for the above transaction
3. Click the Order ID link
4. Select "Partial Exchange" from Actions dropdown
5. Click on Apply action
Expected Result:
The user should be navigated to the Ticket sales portal and search for the Event or Package for Exchanging the TIckets
8. 1. Search and select the package
2.Click onView map
3. Select the number of seats such that it is less than  the number of seats noted down in step 6
4.Click on 'Add and go to Cart'
Expected Result:
-An Error message should be displayed when user is navigated to the cart
-The User should not  be able  to complete transaction
9. Logout of the application
Expected Result:
The user should be able to logout of the application successfully

title: Verify that user can select seats of another hold code during seap upgrade flow - Map Sales page
custom_preconds: seat upgrade permission to a event

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Launch PV Applicationm
Expected Result:
PV Application should be launched successfully.
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
Expected Result:
Login should be successful
3. 1.Create a new event
2.Create a new patron PAT1
5.Perform a sales transactions with 'will call' delivery method for this event EVT1 for this patron PAT1 with sale type as GROUP
Expected Result:
Pre Requisite should be completed successfully
4. 1.Navigate to Event Admin portal
2.Select the event EVT1 mentioned above
3.Navigate to Event Access tab
4.Navigate to the 'User' tab
5.Select any user U1
6.Set the option 'Seat Upgrade' to TRUE under GROUP Sales block
Expected Result:
The 'Seat Upgrade' option should be set to TRUE successfully under the ''GROUP Sale' block
5. 1.Enter a date range for the 'Seat Upgrade' in such a way that current date is INCLUDED in the date range
2.Click APPLY CHANGES
Expected Result:
Changes should be saved successfully
6. 1.Navigate to Application Feature Permisssions portal
2.Select the option 'Sales Permissions' from the 'Set/Modify' drop down
3.Select the user U1 mentioned above
4.Select the option 'Map Sales' for the field 'Default Sales Flow Type'
4.Click APPLY CHANGES
Expected Result:
Default sales flow should be set as 'Map Sales' for the user U1
7. 1.Logout from the Application
2.Login as the user U1 mentioned above in step 4
Expected Result:
Login should be successfull
8. 1.Navigate to Will Call Services portal
2.Search for the will call delivery created above using patron as search criteria
Expected Result:
The will call delivery created earlier should be displayed as search result
9. Verify whether the option SEAT UPGRADE is available
Expected Result:
The SEAT UPGRADE option should be available in the wil call search results page
10. Select the delivery and click the option SEAT UPGRADE
Expected Result:
User should be navigated to the Map Sales page for the same event EVT1.

The event portlet should display this event name.

User should not be able to change this event
11. Verify the Hold Code drop down
Expected Result:
Hold Code drop down' should display the default hold code for the loged in user for this event
12. Verify selecting any other HOLD CODE from the drop down
Expected Result:
User should be able to select any other hold code successfully.

The seat availability displayed should get updated accordingly
13. 1.Select seats of new hold code 
2.Click the option ADD TO CART
Expected Result:
User should be navigated to sales cart successfully with the seats of the selected hold code

The offer type in cart should be displayed as 'Group seat Upgrade sale'
14. 1.Navigate to DELIVERY tab and assign a delivery method
2.Navigate to PAYMENT tab and make payment for the tickets
3.Click CHECKOUT
Expected Result:
Seat Upgrade transaction should be completed successfully
15. 1.Click the Transaction ID link displayed in confirmation page and get navigated to Transaction Details page
2.Verify the Transaction type for the seats involved in this transaction
Expected Result:
Transaction type for returned tickets(initial set of tickets) should be ER 

Transaction type for new set of tickets(newly purchased tickets) should be ES
custom_steps_separated.expected: 1. Seat upgrade via mapsale should be allowed.
